alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 6:44PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern. * WHEN...Until 945 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor street flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield, Rosedale and Oildale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
